newsitem.title: USA: U.S. judge sees no reason against Conrail lock-out.
newsitem.headline: U.S. judge sees no reason against Conrail lock-out.

text.p: A U.S. district court judge said he found no "principled reason" to block a provision in Conrail Inc's CRR.N proposed merger with CSX Corp CSX.N that prohibits both railroads from entering talks with another party until 1999.

"I see no principled reason as to why the lock-out could not be extended for the full period of the contract," said Judge Donald Van Artsdalen, as he began to read his opinion on Norfolk Southern Corp's court challenge.

Van Artsdalen also said there was no reason to grant the motion rival by bidder Norfolk Southern to block a January 17 special meeting, where Conrail shareholders are to vote on a key provision of the merger pact.
The judge also said that evidence was lacking in Norfolk Southern's demand that CSX pay cash for Conrail.
CSX has proposed a cash and stock transaction.
